title: NASA and Roscosmos officials restate intent to operate ISS after 2024
summary: NASA and Roscosmos reiterated that they expect to continue operations of the International Space Station after 2024 as NASA continues to push for an extension to 2030.

title: SpaceX launches Danuri, South Korea’s first mission to the Moon
summary: SpaceX has launched South Korea’s first mission to the Moon on Thursday. A flight-proven Falcon 9 rocket launched the Danuri spacecraft from Space Launch Complex 40 at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida at 7:08 PM EDT (23:08 UTC).

title: China launches secretive reusable test spacecraft
summary: China sent a highly-classified reusable experimental spacecraft into orbit Thursday, two years after a similarly clandestine mission.

title: NESDIS awards enterprise cloud contract to SAIC and Carahsoft
summary: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration announced the award Aug. 3 of a $15 million contract for cloud services to SAIC and Carahsoft.

title: Spire to host second optical payload for South Korea’s Hancom
summary: Spire Global said Aug. 4 it will host a second Earth-imaging payload for Hancom InSpace, which became the first private South Korean company to operate a commercial satellite mission earlier this year.

title: Key Russian official confirms his country’s commitment to the space station
summary: "It was very heartening to hear the support across the board of the partnership."

title: SAM's Top 5 Discoveries Aboard NASA's Curiosity Rover at Mars
summary: “Selfie” of the Curiosity rover with inset showing the SAM instrument prior to installation on the rover.

title: NRO’s spy satellite fleet to become more diverse
summary: NRO Director Scolese said the agency will continue to build large, bespoke satellites but also will increasingly rely on lower cost commercial smallsats

title: Rocket Lab launches top secret payload for U.S. spy satellite agency
summary: Flying the second of back-to-back launches for the National Reconnaissance Office, Rocket Lab placed a classified U.S. government payload into orbit Thursday after a liftoff from New Zealand. It was the third Electron rocket flight in less than six weeks, the busiest stretch of missions in the Rocket Lab’s history.

title: Insurance claim for failed Measat-3 satellite in dispute
summary: An insurance claim for a Malaysian satellite that ran out of fuel prematurely remains unsettled more than a year after the incident.
